intro: Dolichos complanatus, commonly known as the flat bean or sickle bean, is a climbing legume native to tropical and subtropical regions. It produces elongated, flat pods that are typically 10–30 cm in length, containing edible seeds. The plant has trifoliate leaves and is often grown for its nutritional seeds, which are rich in protein and minerals. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Dolichos complanatus is also valued for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, benefiting soil fertility.
